com.github.dm.jrt.builder

Class InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.builder.InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE>
  • Type Parameters:
    TYPE - the configurable object type.
    Enclosing class:
    InvocationConfiguration

    public static final class InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE>
extends Object
    Builder of invocation configurations.

      • set

        @NotNull
public TYPE set()
        Sets the configuration and returns the configurable object.
        Returns:
        the configurable object.

      • with

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> with(@Nullable
                                                 InvocationConfiguration configuration)
        Applies the specified configuration to this builder. A null value means that all the configuration options need to be set to their default value, otherwise only the set options will be applied.
        Parameters:
        configuration - the invocation configuration.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withCoreInstances

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withCoreInstances(int coreInstances)
        Sets the number of invocation instances, which represents the core pool of reusable invocations. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        coreInstances - the core number of instances.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number is negative.

      • withInputMaxSize

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withInputMaxSize(int inputMaxSize)
        Sets the maximum number of data that the input channel can retain before they are consumed. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        inputMaxSize - the maximum size.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number is less than 1.

      • withInputOrder

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withInputOrder(@Nullable
                                                           InvocationConfiguration.OrderType orderType)
        Sets the order in which input data are collected from the input channel. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Note that this is just the initial configuration of the invocation, since the channel order can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.
        Parameters:
        orderType - the order type.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withInputTimeout

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withInputTimeout(long timeout,
                                                             @NotNull
                                                             TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the timeout for an input channel to have room for additional data.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout.
        timeUnit - the timeout time unit.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified timeout is negative.

      • withMaxInstances

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withMaxInstances(int maxInstances)
        Sets the max number of concurrently running invocation instances. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        maxInstances - the max number of instances.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number is less than 1.

      • withOutputMaxSize

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withOutputMaxSize(int outputMaxSize)
        Sets the maximum number of data that the result channel can retain before they are consumed. A DEFAULT value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        outputMaxSize - the maximum size.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number is less than 1.

      • withOutputOrder

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withOutputOrder(@Nullable
                                                            InvocationConfiguration.OrderType orderType)
        Sets the order in which output data are collected from the result channel. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default order one.
        Note that this is just the initial configuration of the invocation, since the channel order can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.
        Parameters:
        orderType - the order type.
        Returns:
        this builder.

        Parameters:

        timeUnit - the timeout time unit.
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • withPriority

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withPriority(int priority)
        Sets the invocation priority. A DEFAULT value means that the invocations will be executed with no specific priority.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        See Also:
        PriorityRunner

      • withReadTimeout

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withReadTimeout(long timeout,
                                                            @NotNull
                                                            TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the timeout for an invocation instance to produce a readable result.
        Note that this is just the initial configuration of the invocation, since the output timeout can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout.
        timeUnit - the timeout time unit.
        Returns:
        this builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified timeout is negative.

      • withReadTimeout

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withReadTimeout(@Nullable
                                                            TimeDuration timeout)
        Sets the timeout for an invocation instance to produce a readable result. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Note that this is just the initial configuration of the invocation, since the output timeout can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • withReadTimeoutAction

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withReadTimeoutAction(@Nullable
                                                                  InvocationConfiguration.TimeoutActionType actionType)
        Sets the action to be taken if the timeout elapses before a result can be read from the output channel. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Note that this is just the initial configuration of the invocation, since the output timeout action can be dynamically changed through the dedicated methods.
        Parameters:
        actionType - the action type.
        Returns:
        this builder.

        @NotNull
public InvocationConfiguration.Builder<TYPE> withRunner(@Nullable
                                                       Runner runner)
        Sets the asynchronous runner instance. A null value means that it is up to the specific implementation to choose a default one.
        Parameters:
        runner - the runner instance.
        Returns:
        this builder.
